channel.title: Do NOT lose items upon death
channel.description:
I am currently making a new funpking area, and I have it almost to perfection. The problem is, you do NOT lose items EQUIPPED when you die, but you DO lose items that are NOT equipped, such as food, dds, etc.
How would I make this so it keeps all the items? I just need a basic code, I can add it myself.
Source: All-star

item.title: Do NOT lose items upon death
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

if (playerLevel[3] < 1) { if (isInArea()) { NewHP = getLevelForXP(playerHitpoints); playerLevel[3] = NewHP; Teleport(x, y, h); sendMsg("Oh dear, you have died!"); } else { applyDead(); } }

Read full topic
item.source: Do NOT lose items upon death

item.title: Do NOT lose items upon death
item.dc:creator: @smkscape smkscape
item.description:
@smkscape wrote:

[quote=“chassy13, post:6, topic:239735”]Here is my youdied method:

[code]public void youdied()
{
if(funpk()) {
teleportToX = 3248;
teleportToY = 9364;
heightLevel = 0;
//pEmote = 10;
//pWalk = 13;
sendMessage(“You died at funpk lmfao?”);
hitDiff = 0;
updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
} else if(!funpk()) {
for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) {
try {
int item = playerEquipment[r];
if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
deleteItem(6570, getItemSlot(6570), 1);
sendMessage(“Your Fire Cape vanishes as it hits the floor”);
remove(item, r);
}
} catch(Exception e) { sendMessage(“ERROR: Removing Equipment”); }
}

for(int r=0; r<playerEquipment.length; r++) {
try {
int item = playerEquipment[r];
if((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
deleteItem(6570, getItemSlot(6570), 1);
sendMessage(“Your Fire Cape vanishes as it hits the floor”);
remove(item, r);
}
} catch(Exception e) { sendMessage(“ERROR: Removing Equipment”); }
}
}
for (int rr = 0; rr < playerItems.length; rr++) {
try {
if (playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {
// createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr] - 1, absX, absY,
playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
// createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]);
deleteItem(playerItems[rr] - 1,
getItemSlot(playerItems[rr] - 1), playerItemsN[rr]);
}
} catch (Exception e) {}
}
if(funpk()) {
teleportToX = 3248;
teleportToY = 9364;
heightLevel = 0;
//pEmote = 10;
//pWalk = 13;
sendMessage(“You died at funpk lmfao?”);
hitDiff = 0;
updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
} else if(!funpk()) {
removeAllItems();
for (int r = 0; r < playerEquipment.length; r++) {
try {
int item = playerEquipment[r];

            if ((item > 0) && (item < 20000)) {
                remove(item, r);
            }
        } catch (Exception e) {
            sendMessage("ERROR: Removing Equipment");
        }
    }

}
for (int rr = 0; rr < playerItems.length; rr++) {
try {
if (playerItems[rr] > 0 && playerItems[rr] < 20000) {
// createItem(currentX,currentY,playerItems[rr]-1);
ItemHandler.addItem(playerItems[rr] - 1, absX, absY,
playerItemsN[rr], KillerId, false);
// createGroundItem(playerItems[rr]-1, absX, absY, playerItemsN[i]);
deleteItem(playerItems[rr] - 1,
getItemSlot(playerItems[rr] - 1), playerItemsN[rr]);
}
} catch (Exception e) {}
}
removeAllItems();
teleportToX = 3248;
teleportToY = 9364;
// pEmote = 15;
// pWalk = 13;
sendMessage(“Oh Dear, you have died”);
hitDiff = 0;
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
}[/code]

and my boolean:

public boolean funpk() { if ((absX >= 2437 && absX <= 2448 && absY >= 4951 && absY <= 4961)) return true; else return false; }

and zip-lock, if you meant rune~server, i cant get on that :/[/quote]

How i can do that for delta ?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @superxero superxero
item.description:
@superxero wrote:

Im not a pro but im prety sure it is somthing typed… because everything is remove items… remove equpits should be included in there, pretty sure… removeAllItems(); see? i think there should be removeAllEquipts(); also… i can’t help though sorry… its a lead though. Just wait it out, some pro coder will help, specialy if this one stays at the top.

Read full topic
